bibl.title: Alfonso Gagliardi v. T.W. Lynch
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Alfonso Gagliardi for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

The undersigned hereby acknowledgesreceipt from F.M. Harshberger, Clerk United States District Court, of two receipts given by Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration, dated Seattle, Washington, October 19, 1921, to Angelo Marra, for 2 United States Third Liberty Loan Gold Bonds of the face value of Five Hundred Dollars each, serial numbers -122,559- and -122,560-, the same having been held by said Commissioner of Immigration subject to an assignment thereof to the Clerk of the U.S. District Court at Seattle, Wash., as additional surety on the bond of Alfonso Gagliardi in cause No. 6443 entitled "In the Matter of the Application of Alfonso Gagliardi for a Writ of Habeas Corpus" in this court, said cause having been dismissed and the bond exonerated and said bonds ordered delivered to the surety on said bonds, to wit, "Angelo Marra", or his order.
